javadoc: GhidraProtocolConnector provides an abtract implementation to access Ghidra repositories using various underlying communication protocols. The common requirement for all implementations is the ability to derive a repository URL from any folder or file URL.

methods.name: getResponseCode
methods.comment: Gets the status code from a Ghidra URL connect response.

return.comment: the Ghidra Status-Code, or -1 if not yet connected

methods.javadoc:
Gets the repository name associated with the URL.
@return the repository name or null if URL does not identify a specific repository
methods.name: getRepositoryName
methods.comment: Gets the repository name associated with the URL.

return.comment: the repository name or null if URL does not identify a specific repository

methods.javadoc:
Get the RepositoryAdapter associated with a URL which specifies a repository.
@return repository adapter or null if a project locator is supplied instead
methods.name: getRepositoryAdapter
methods.comment: Get the RepositoryAdapter associated with a URL which specifies a repository.

return.comment: repository adapter or null if a project locator is supplied instead

methods.name: getRepositoryServerAdapter
methods.comment:
Get the RepositoryServerAdapter associated with a URL which specifies a repository or
 repository server.

return.comment: repository server adapter or null if a project locator is supplied instead

methods.javadoc:
Gets the repository folder path associated with the URL.
 If an ambiguous path has been specified, the folder path may change
 after a connection is established (e.g., folder item name will be appended 
 to folder path and item name will become null if item turns out to
 be a folder).
@return repository folder path or null
methods.name: getFolderPath
methods.comment:
Gets the repository folder path associated with the URL.
 If an ambiguous path has been specified, the folder path may change
 after a connection is established (e.g., folder item name will be appended 
 to folder path and item name will become null if item turns out to
 be a folder).

methods.javadoc:
Gets the repository folder item name associated with the URL.
 If an ambiguous path has been specified, the folder item name may become null
 after a connection is established (e.g., folder item name will be appended 
 to folder path and item name will become null if item turns out to
 be a folder).
@return folder item name or null
methods.name: getFolderItemName
methods.comment:
Gets the repository folder item name associated with the URL.
 If an ambiguous path has been specified, the folder item name may become null
 after a connection is established (e.g., folder item name will be appended 
 to folder path and item name will become null if item turns out to
 be a folder).

methods.name: connect
methods.comment:
Connect to the resource specified by the associated URL.  This method should only be invoked
 once, a second attempt may result in an IOException.

params.name: readOnly
params.comment: if resource should be requested for write access.

methods.name: isReadOnly
methods.comment: Determines the read-only nature of a connected resource

throws.comment: if connect has not yet been performed

return.comment: true if read-only, false if write access allowed

name: GhidraProtocolConnector
comment:
GhidraProtocolConnector provides an abtract implementation to access Ghidra 
 repositories using various underlying communication protocols.  The common requirement 
 for all implementations is the ability to derive a repository URL from any folder or file
 URL.
